comment: It's just not good bourbon. It has a stale taste that only becomes tolerable after about three glasses.
Not bad and surprisingly smooth. Sweet in the beginning turning to leather and slight fruit. A great buy for mixing.

Nose - Initial nose is a bit harsh, rough ethanol. Transitions to hints of pineapple and a what seems like a very mellow honey that's been left out on the counter a bit too long. Hints of green apple skin, mint, and like a young sapling that's just been cut.
Taste - Faint hints of pear and apples that aren't quite ripe. So slightly dry and mildly sweet. Mellow hints of unripe bananas which transitions a bit into an unpleasant varnish like that used for finger nails.
Finish - Has a slight burn for the proof but feels a bit thin. Leaves you with a very dry mouthfeel that transitions to what I think is like if you took a bite into a dry, powdery apple that happened to taste like an unripe plantain. Has an oddly long finish that just sort of lingers and leaves an odd sour dill taste in your mouth.
71/100
Great bourbon for 20 bucks. Strong notes of vanilla and caramel with a long finish. Smooth on the rocks.
Mild drinking, good everyday bourbon.  Not overly special, don’t use this to impress guests.

Sleeper bourbon.  Definitely surpassed my expectations for the money and marketing fail of a name.

Slightly sweet at first, then comes some tartness, wood, char, and red hots.  Decently long finish.  A little hot, but flavorful.

Reminds me a bit of a younger, brasher, Rowan's Creek
avg; good price; Ive only seen at Total Wine ...
great mixer, cheap price point, won't wow you but mix it and you will never know
Nice sweet honey taste and slightly hot finish
The name says it all.  Smoother on the taste but harsh on the finish.  Impulse buy and I need to resist the impulse in the future.

Not terrible but nothing special. Tasted at a friend’s place. Was told it was ‘cheap’ and if that’s the case it’s really not bad at all for the price. Would be a good mixer and a small step up to replace Beam/Jack with some Coke. 

Ironically 2 stars gets 2 stars. But maybe that’s exactly the market they are going for with the whisky.
I give two stars, two stars.
Basically Barton's runoff spirit, the rye shines through an otherwise simplistic bourbon. Better than most value bourbons, however. Taste like Blanton
Not bad. Just ok on the rocks
Great taste and easy drinking, comes with a good price point

For the money  extra half Star
Slightly sweet at first, then comes some tartness, wood, char, and red hots. Decently long finish. A little hot, but flavorful.
It isn’t smooth. For a very low price it is actually nice. A little harsh but solid flavor.
Decent wheated bourbon.  Perfectly good for sipping with a little bit of water.

Nose: apple, caramel, vanilla, cedar boards.
Palate: carries from the nose with some oak barrel spice and honey. A slight touch of that banana note you find in Jack Daniels. 
Finish: sweet oak vanilla and orchard fruit. 
This is solid for the price. An easy sipper and I would never turn down a glass. That said, it’s a bottom shelfer and shows in youthfulness and lack of integration. The flavors kind of hit all over the place and shows no real complexity. But, it far exceeded my expectations and drinks sweet and no harshness.

It is what it is. Gave this 2.5 just for the price; $20 a bottle for a decent mixer isn’t a bad value.

Wouldn’t go out of my way for this otherwise. A not so sweet Maker’s Mark is the best review I’ve heard for this. Cheers!!

Decent with a rock, I enjoyed it very much after moving from a neat glass to rocks in a rocks glass.

Started neat and had a nose and taste of grass.

W/ice.  Mild grass with a sweet taste.  Very short finish with front of tongue taste.

I don’t remember what I paid for this bourbon but I don’t think it was expensive.  Maybe 20-25.   You can find better at this price but it’s not bad.
Opens up sweeter notes with a rock - nothing special
Great bourbon for price.. Has a good nose and initial front end taste similar to BT but then it finishes smooth and kind of sweet
Good for mixing Manhattan or with soda. Not much of a sipper
Bottom shelf, would be fine in a Manhattan but not a sipper.
Smooth and sweet with some spice on the end
Good for the price.  Mild.  But does the trick
Slightly smoky and slightly sweet. The first bottle of whiskey I’ve ever bought.
Simple and smooth. Giving extra star for price
Not terribly complex but an easy drinker

Nose : Light Gold
Nose :Banana, Vanilla 
Pallet: Oily, Butterscotch, Spice 
Finish: Mild duration, Medicinal
Moderately smooth but I think there are better values.  Has almost a slightly smokey nearly peaty touch like a scotch.  But not.
I found this to be quite sippable and decent for the price.
Very easy to drink. Not overly complex, but you get a little bit of vanilla cinnamon and a little of the barrel. Can't beat it for the price.
Classic bourbon on the nose with nothing crazy to it. The taste is non-offensive with a bit of spice in.
